alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Butler; Cape Girardeau; Carter; New Madrid; Perry; Ripley; Stoddard; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 2:01PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Graves, Bollinger, southeastern Carter, western Perry, New Madrid, eastern Ripley, Wayne, Butler, western Cape Girardeau, and Stoddard Counties through 245 PM CST... At 200 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over southeast Missouri, from between Marble Hill and Greenville, to near Neelyville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Grassy around 205 PM CST. Marble Hill and Leopold around 215 PM CST. Malden and Clarkton around 220 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bernie, Bollinger Mill State Historic Site, Burfordville, Parma and Risco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 9 and 33. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 32 and 36, near Mile Marker 50, and between Mile Markers 125 and 139. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for western Kentucky...and southeastern Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Bollinger; Butler; Cape Girardeau; Carter; New Madrid; Perry; Ripley; Stoddard; Wayne
